name: Cyber Windows Remote Management
description: This app integrates with the Windows Remote Management service to execute various actions

endpoint.description: IP/Hostname (For TEST CONNECTIVITY and default, if not provided in an action)
endpoint.name: endpoint

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Execute a command on the endpoint
actions.verbose:
Unless you implement a custom parser, this action will always succeed regardless of the input. Either a command or pair of command_id and shell_id must be specified. If a command_id is present, all other parameters will be ignored.

Note: The command_id and shell_id you provide to fetch the output can only be used once because once the output is fetched successfully server will remove output from its cache.

parser.description: The vault ID of a custom parser to use for output
parser.name: parser

async.description: Start the command, but don't wait for output
async.name: async

command_id.description: Command ID of async command (Provide with shell_id)
command_id.name: command_id

shell_id.description: Shell ID of async command (Provide with command_id)
shell_id.name: shell_id

actions.description: Run a PowerShell script on the endpoint
actions.verbose:
The script you provide can either be in the vault, or it can just be a string of the script to run. If both values are present, it will use the script_file over the script_str. Unless you implement a custom parser, this action will always succeed regardless of the input. If command_id and shell_id are present, script_file and script_str will be ignored. This action will fail if at least one of script_file, script_str, or the pair of command_id and shell_id are not specified.

Note: The command_id and shell_id you provide to fetch the output can only be used once because once the output is fetched successfully server will remove output from its cache.

script_file.description: The vault ID of a PowerShell script to run
script_file.name: script_file

parser.description: The vault ID of a custom parser to use for output
parser.name: parser

async.description: Start the command, but don't wait for output
async.name: async

command_id.description: Command ID of async command (Provide with shell_id)
command_id.name: command_id

shell_id.description: Shell ID of async command (Provide with command_id)
shell_id.name: shell_id

pid.description: The PID of the process to terminate
pid.name: pid

name.description: Name of program to terminate, accepts wildcards
name.name: name

actions.verbose: When you are using the other parameter, you can match for any field which is returned in the action result. It will only return a rule if it matches all of the criteria, not if it matches at least one.

filter_port.description: Only show firewall rules acting on this port
filter_port.name: filter_port

filter_ip.description: Only show firewall rules acting on this ip
filter_ip.name: filter_ip

direction.description: Only show firewall rules in this direction
direction.name: direction

protocol.description: Only show firewall rules using this protocol
protocol.name: protocol

other.description: JSON object of key value pairs of other fields to match
other.name: other

actions.description: Remove a firewall rule using netsh
actions.verbose: This action will invoke the command netsh advfirewall firewall delete rule, and the rest is determined by the input. At a minimum, the rule name must be provided, but if you need to you can also specify any other arguments which the command accepts, in the same manner, that input from the add firewall rule gets added.

name.description: The name of the rule to remove
name.name: name

remote_ip.description: Firewall rule acts on this remote IP
remote_ip.name: remote_ip

local_ip.description: Firewall rule acts on this local IP
local_ip.name: local_ip

remote_port.description: Firewall rule acts on this remote port
remote_port.name: remote_port

local_port.description: Firewall rule acts on this local port
local_port.name: local_port

protocol.description: Firewall rule acts on this protocol
protocol.name: protocol

other.description: JSON object of key value pairs for other parameters to include
other.name: other

actions.description: Create a firewall rule to block a specified IP

name.description: The name of the rule to add
name.name: name

actions.description: Add a firewall rule using netsh
actions.verbose: This action will invoke the command netsh advfirewall firewall add rule, where the rest is determined by the input. Each key-value pair from the other parameter will be added in the form of key=value. The user input will be sanitized.

name.description: The name of the rule to add
name.name: name

action.description: What the firewall will do with packets
action.name: action

remote_ip.description: Firewall rule acts on this remote IP
remote_ip.name: remote_ip

local_ip.description: Firewall rule acts on this local IP
local_ip.name: local_ip

remote_port.description: Firewall rule acts on this remote port
remote_port.name: remote_port

local_port.description: Firewall rule acts on this local port
local_port.name: local_port

protocol.description: Firewall rule acts on this protocol
protocol.name: protocol

other.description: JSON object of key value pairs for other parameters to include
other.name: other

actions.verbose: Deactivates the system partitions of a machine, which disallows booting from said partition. The subsequent boot of the machine results in using the next option specified in the BIOS to boot from. Often used to netboot for remote reimaging.

ldap.description: LDAP Server. Will only have an effect if 'location' is set to 'domain'
ldap.name: ldap

example_values: Allows members of the Everyone group to run packaged apps that are signed.

actions.description: Create a new AppLocker policy to block a file path
actions.verbose: By default, this policy will apply to the "Everyone" group. You can specify the user with either a variety of formats, which are documented here. By specifying LDAP, it will apply that policy to that GPO, as opposed to just the local machine. By default, Windows does not have the service required service running for AppLocker policies to be enforced. The Application Identity service must be running for AppLocker to enforce its policies.

deny_allow.description: Set this rule to allow or deny
deny_allow.name: deny_allow

file_path.description: File path to set rule to. Allows wildcards (i.e. C:\Windows\System32\*.exe)
file_path.name: file_path

user.description: User or group to apply rule to
user.name: user

actions.description: Copy a file from the Windows Endpoint to the Vault

example_values: Successfully retrieved file and added it to the Vault

actions.description: Copy a file from the vault to the Windows Endpoint
Run the copy command on the Windows Endpoint
actions.verbose: For best results, both the from and to parameters should be absolute paths to their respective locations.

actions.description: Run the delete command on the Windows Endpoint
actions.verbose: For best results, the file path parameter should be an absolute path to a location.

force.description: Use the force flag for delete
force.name: force

recurse.description: Use the recurse flag to delete directory content recursively
recurse.name: recurse
